attributes.action: Stop the Remain starting a new Referendum and live with the result
attributes.additional_details: The 1975 vote to take us in the Common market only had  65% turnout much less than this at 72%, so using that part (based on the current argued criterita for a 2nd referendum) should we not have a re-run then of the 1975 vote? Also there is speculation in law that the additional 2million extra registrations after the cut off date have scewed the true figure for exit, which would have been closer to 58-60% had these not been allowed unlawfully that reching a possable 20% difference.
attributes.background: This country was built on a democratic process the remain lost, it does not matter if by one or one million, its time to work together to make this country Great again not winge about the fair and valid result, you had your chance you lost the argument.
